billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS

title: Prohibits bonds or notes of public authorities and public benefit corporations from extending beyond period of probable usefulness
summary: Prohibits public authorities and public benefit corporations from issuing bonds and notes for a work or purpose which extends beyond the probable life of the work project.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Corporations,  Authorities
         and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public authorities law, in relation to bonds and
         notes of public authorities and public benefit corporations

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  public  authorities  law  is amended by adding a new
    2  section 2881 to read as follows:
    3    S 2881. BONDS AND NOTES  OF  PUBLIC  AUTHORITIES  AND  PUBLIC  BENEFIT
    4  CORPORATIONS.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, ON AND AFTER
    5  THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS SECTION, NO DEBT SECURED BY A  BOND  OR  NOTE
    6  FOR  A  WORK  OR  PURPOSE ISSUED BY A PUBLIC AUTHORITY OR PUBLIC BENEFIT
    7  CORPORATION CREATED BY OR PURSUANT TO NEW YORK STATE LAW,  WHETHER  SUCH
    8  AUTHORITY OR CORPORATION IS OTHERWISE GOVERNED BY THIS CHAPTER, SHALL BE
    9  CONTRACTED  FOR  A  PERIOD  LONGER THAN THE PROBABLE LIFE OF THE WORK OR
   10  PURPOSE FOR WHICH THE DEBT IS TO BE CONTRACTED.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   12  have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2319

TITLE OF BILL:
An act to amend the public authorities law, in relation to bonds and
notes of public authorities and public benefit corporations

SUMMARY:
This bill adds a new section 2881 to the public Authorities Law. The new
section will provide that the bonding activities of public authorities
and public benefit corporations would be restricted in order that no
bond or note may be issued for a purpose with a probable life shorter
than the contract life of the bond or note.

JUSTIFICATION:
The State constitution forbids the State from issuing bonds for purposes
with an expected life shorter than the contract life of the bond itself.
The purpose of this constitutional provision is to prevent the State
from bonding out its operations costs. This bill would extend the same
principal of fiscal soundness to all public authorities and public bene-
fit corporations created by or pursuant to New York State law.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
No cost to the State.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall have
become a law.
